channel.title: [WILL REP++] Simple Help Needed With SWATS Client 2010
channel.description:
Hi.
Well, I just wanna know how I change the NPC Bits from 16 to 12 (if this is client sided, if not I still would like to know), and I also would like to know how to change the port on the client from 43595 to 43594 - or how to change the port on the server from 43594 to 43595 (I would rather change the client's port.)
I don't have a GUI.java or EGUI.java
Once again, I will Rep ++ whoever helps me solve this. Whoever answers first with the correct solution will get the Rep.
Thank you.

item.title: [WILL REP++] Simple Help Needed With SWATS Client 2010
item.dc:creator: @Ace1 Ace.
item.description:
@Ace1 wrote:

Thank you! Repped.

Read full topic

item.title: [WILL REP++] Simple Help Needed With SWATS Client 2010
item.dc:creator: @badger41 badger41
item.description:
@badger41 wrote:

Server sided. In player.java find:

		str.writeBits(12, npc.npcType);

You know what to do from there.

And client sided, in client.java find: aClass24_1168 = new Class24(this, -978, method19(43595 + anInt958));

change 43595 to 43594, dont remove the + anInt958.

There you go, enjoy.

Read full topic
item.source: [WILL REP++] Simple Help Needed With SWATS Client 2010

item.title: [WILL REP++] Simple Help Needed With SWATS Client 2010

item.description:
@Scape-JAVA wrote:

[quote=“Ace., post:3, topic:362231”]I don’t have a Config.java Client sided nor Server sided.

Do you suggest looking in the Client.java in either the Server Side or the Client Side?[/quote]

Client sided.
